column4: is there some alternative to windows media player in ubuntu? cause VLC doesnt have mush options
mplayer
eee no
you can play mp3 files with it if you wish
for music, mplayer is not the right program.
there is no program which has music+video functionality as windows media player
for music you can use amarok or rhythmbox
or banshee
or beep-media-player (less functionality)
use amarok then
sure, music files only not videos
ok
amarok is better than rhythmbox, try it
not suprising given the bad quality of windows based software
yes
is very good at it. Uses an internal (or configurable external) relational database
so amarok scales very well with huge playlists
try it is one of the best players available (if not the best)
and it doesnt matter if my music is on ntfs partition that i mounted and is in read-only mode ?
it should not make any difference.
you can even access your mp3 player very easy
